  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    REVMechanism(com.revrobotics.spark.SparkBase motor, boolean attached)
    Multi-Purpose subsystem class based on 3847 Spectrum's Mechanism class utlizing PID Closed-Loop and Max Motion positional or velocity control, and WPILib Units Only use one control method per mechanism, PLEASE!

  • Constructor Details

    • REVMechanism

      public REVMechanism(com.revrobotics.spark.SparkBase motor, boolean attached)
      Multi-Purpose subsystem class based on 3847 Spectrum's Mechanism class utlizing PID Closed-Loop and Max Motion positional or velocity control, and WPILib Units Only use one control method per mechanism, PLEASE!
      Parameters:
      attached - for if the motor is in use

    • getVelocitySetpointGoal

      public boolean getVelocitySetpointGoal(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularVelocity target, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularVelocity error)
      Checks if the motor is reaching the velocity setpoint
      Parameters:
      target - the target RPM to reach
      error - allowed error in RPM
      Returns:
      true if the motor's RPM is within the error of the target RPM

    • getPositionSetpointGoal

      public boolean getPositionSetpointGoal(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Angle target, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Angle error)
      Checks if the motor is reaching the rotational setpoint
      Parameters:
      target - the target rotation angle
      error - allowed error in rotations (keep SMALL)
      Returns:
      true if the motor's angle position is within the error of the target angle position

    • getAngleSetpointGoal

      Parameters:
      target - the target rotation angle
      error - allowed error in rotation (keep SMALL)
      Returns:

      public boolean getOutputSetpointGoal(double target, double error)

      Parameters:
      target - the target output to reach
      error - allowed error
      Returns:
      true if the motor's output is within the error of the target output

    • setMotorPosition

      public void setMotorPosition(edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Angle position, double arbff)
      Sets the mechanism position of the motor based on constant value with ArbFF
      Parameters:
      position - Measure of Angle; Converted to Rotations
      arbff - A value from which is represented in voltage applied to the motor after the result of the specified control mode. The units for the parameter is Volts.
